result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar J Salaam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
with elements

Cases 16CF286 and 15CF401 called together at 11:46am [mo]
Defendant Omar J Salaam in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CF286:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no discussion of the case with Candise Anderson
--booking at JESO today

As to Case 15CF401:
Service of Amended Informatin Admitted; reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2, #4, and #5 of Case 15CF401; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all reamaining counts.

On Counts #2, #4, and #5, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--anger management and/or certified Batterer's Intervention Programming and/or psychological assessement/ treatment, per agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Terry Vogel
--no possession of any dangerous weapons 
--no acts or threats of violence 
--not possess or consume illegal drugs
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed  and provide agent with documentation of all current prescriptions
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--pay all statutory costs
--to pay $137.50 is subpoena fees


Days credit for time already served: 0  days
recess: 12:09am

Defendant Omar J Salaam in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Extradition Forecast
Scheduling
Jury trial on August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on August 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 10:16 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Omar J Salaam in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall informs the Court that based upon the emails from DA Happ, that the victim will be served today because the victim is is in-custody at the Jefferson County Jail. State will be ready to proceed to trial on scheduled trial dates
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are ready to proceed to trial
Court informs parties that It will leave trial on calendar as scheduled and reminds Mr. Salaam that FSSC date is the last date to enter plea
ADA Hall informs the Court that officer is not available for trial, requests trial be rescheduled
Court cancels July trial dates and reschedules trial, upon no objection from defense
Court reminds Mr. Salaam that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending
Recess: 10:21 am 

NEXT: (1) Reschedule FSSC 8/23/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 8/29-30/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
of Intent to Admit Certified Medical Records - States
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Case called at 10:51 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Salaam does not appear due to Court's earlier ruling that he may be excused from today's hearing
DA Happ informs the Court that they have been unable to serve the victim in this file. Requests adjournment, presents basis including this is first request for adjournment and diligent attempts at service. Service will again be attempted again this morning, believe that service is being avoided due to warrant on pending matter. If the Court grants adjourment request, would suggest a STC prior to FSSC so would know if were able to serve victim. If the problem persists, may move to dismiss without prejudice. 
Atty Svehlek requests dismissal rather than adjourment, presents basis
Court presents basis and adjourns trial dates. Court informs parties that if State is unable to obtain service, will consider dismissal or issuance of witness warrant
Court directs Atty Svehlek to communicate dates to Mr. Salaam since he is not here in person
Court continues bond and removes trial from the calendar
Recess: 11:00 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 6/23/16 at 9:45 am - Send notices (2) Reschedule FSSC 7/5/16 at 1:15 pm - Send notices (3) Reschedule JT 7/18-19/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Final status/scheduling conference on June 2, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Case called at 3:31 pm [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Omar J Salaam in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are prepared to proceed to trial
Counsel agree that this is one day trial 
DA Happ informs the Court that they do not have proof of service on victim and that pre-trial motions have not been filed; requests that the Court have Final-FPT on Thursday. Would not object to not having Mr. Salaam appearing at that time. 
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that if the Court does have additional FSSC, would request the court excuse Mr. Salaam, presents basis. 
Mr. Salaam requests to be excused from Thursday's hearing - Court grants & directs Mr. Salaam to appear Monday morning at 8:30 am for trial

DA Happ informs the Court that the State will have 5 witnesses, 3 officers, victim and citizen witness
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that the defense may have 1 citizen witness, Candice Anderson

1 alternate, 5 strikes each
jurors may take notes and ask questions

DA Happ informs the Court that they do have statements they intend to introduce at trial and understand that Atty Svehlek has no Miranda Goodchild issues
Court finds there is No Miranda Goodchild Issues as it relates statements attributed to the defendant and as included in the discovery
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Svehlek informs the Court that she did not discuss plea entry deadline with Mr. Salaam; Court has colloquy with Mr. Salaam
DA Happ informs the Court that it appears the victim has open warrant - may have service issues
Court informs parties that It will either adjourn trial or dismiss matter
Atty Svhlek requests the Court still excuse Mr. Salaam's appearance for Thursday even if the Court must address legal matters
Mr. Salaam affirms his request to be excused from Thursday's hearing
Recess: 3:41 pm 

NEXT: (1) Trial to proceed Monday at 8:30 am (2) Mr. Salaam's appearance is excused - Notices given in court - Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on June 6 or 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:19pm. 
Defendant Omar J Salaam appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Salaam indicates that his correct address is:  205 Western Avenue, Watertown WI. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $100 Cash Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Terry Vogel or Javin Vogel
--not to discuss the case with Candice Anderson
--no possession of dangerous weapons as defined by Statute [Statute 939.22(10)]
recess 1:25pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/13/16 at 10:40am,  (2) Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 8:30am
